reviews.review_msg: This class assumes that you have a really solid grasp of linear algebra. Lecture notes help since Ben lectures off the book at a different order and omits plenty of topics. Problem sets and computing assignments are not too difficult. Exams are tough, midterm was with choice to answer 4 out of 5, final exam with 7 out of 9 questions.

Very good teacher. He's good at conveying complicated concepts and goes through material at a very good pace. Assignments were way too easy (just simple MATLAB code), but midterms and final were kinda unfair: they focused on practical, numerical examples, whereas the lectures focused on theory. Course material was quite useful.
Professor Nilima is very kind and keen on answering questions. Lectures are based on textbooks and exams are fair. Definitely recommend !

So much textbook reading. Lectures essentially cover 300 pages of text. Lectures disorganized visually with so much fast writing. "Study everything" for tests. Mean in office hours; made me feel stupid for asking questions and discouraged me from attending. 5 hours of OH a week was nice. LONG assignments, but MATLAB is cool. NOT LIKE MACM316 AT ALL

Macm 409 is a challenging and useful course. Course materials are all about numerical algorithms. Dr. Nigam shows us how those algorithms could be used in mathematical and data science field. There are lots of interesting applications in the homework. She is very helpful and friendly in her office hour. Besides, She has high expectation.

A major problem with Trummer is that his notes are very incoherent, and lack any kind of structure or commentary almost as if you took the textbook, removed all the words, and left in only formulas and diagrams.  Luckily the text was pretty good.

Lectures left you feeling you knew less than you did coming in. Explanations on concepts were abstract, if not non-existent, and homework was time consuming and very difficult. Tests were also very difficult. Overall, not a good prof.
